captions.text:
Hey Youtube, you said you wanted to talk.
What's up?

Why do you go around making other people look
stupid?
What do you mean?
What's water made of?
Water.
Hahaha,
What makes water?
Water.
Ok, what elements does it take to make water?
H2O
So what does that mean?
That it's water.
OK, OK, so that was one example
Really.

Carbon dioxide, everything emits carbon dioxide,
trees, human beings. I guess like um animals.

So trees are contributing to the...
Definitely, but it's yeah, definitely. So

trees are I guess the, one of the original
primary sources of, emitters of CO2

So trees are just like anything else on this
Earth that emits carbon dioxide.

I could do this all day
Enough. enough.

You know what I think? I think you do it to
feel superior.

Oh, yeah, maybe that's it. Maybe I'm just
an egotistical jerk who delights in humiliating
other people.

Well that fact certainly hasn't gone unnoticed
by your viewers.

You come across a little condescending in
these interviews.

you basically set up every single question
to make the other people look like idiots
this guy is a pretentious douche bag

I f^&%ing hate this youtube channel. It makes
every single person it interviews look like

a complete retard. Not everyones a physicist
so get the %$^& over it.
Stop! Alright, my viewers don't own me.

Actually, you should have read the T's and
C's more carefully. By seeing your ads, your
viewers do, in fact, own you.
Aw, man!

Yeah, now, c'mon -- between you and me -- how
selectively do you have to pick through your

interviews to make people look that dumb?
I mean some of them

If you want to see the complete interviews,
then why don't you click the annotation. You

can judge for yourself. Did you ever think
that the reason I start with misconceptions

is because I wrote my PhD on how to design
films to teach physics? And I found that if

you just say the correct stuff
Trees get most of their mass from carbon dioxide...
Yep, pretty much covers it.

Viewers don't actually learn anything -- they
just feel like they're learning and they become

more confident in the things they thought
beforehand.

So what you're saying is you make people look
stupid so you can teach others -- how noble!

But that's just it! I don't think these people
are stupid. There's a difference between being

unknowledgeable and being unintelligent. I
mean I'm unknowledgeable about lots of stuff.

And science can be hard -- for the particular
reason that it's counterintuitive. So I think

we should acknowledge what everyone is thinking,
what most people are thinking and use that
as our basis for teaching.

But if you actually believe that, then why
does your face light up with glee every time
you hear a misconception?

Because in that moment I realize that I can
be useful. I can help people learn the truth

-- and that's the point of Veritasium -- to
help people understand the truths of the natural

world and seek the truth in their own lives.
As Richard Feynman said, "The first principle

is that you must not fool yourself -- and
you are the easiest person to fool."
This guy is a pretentious douche bag.

title: Why Do You Make People Look Stupid?

comments.text:
It takes a fool to believe he has nothing left to learn. By pointing out 
these "misconceptions" you teach in a better way then teaching something 
new.

I know there are many things I do not and may never know. But to take 
something I "think" I know and correct it the lesson is twofold. Removing 
something I am incorrect about, and adding the correct knowledge in it's 
place.﻿

comments.author: Skoteh90

comments.text:
That's good to hear. My response was based on my first impression of him. 
I've only seen 3 of his videos. Maybe my first impression, with little 
background in his methods, will shed some light on his question of why 
people label him as a jerk.

Yeah, he should make sure his subject is aware of what is causing him to 
laugh, that is where my miss communication resides from. From a new 
viewer's standpoint it does not come off as light hearted, it comes off as 
him finding humor in their lack of understanding of the complex physical 
systems of our reality.

My interpretation of his laughter is based on many many past experiences 
and is a common interpretation of laughter at an answer to a question from 
a stranger. I've seen many people and teachers in my past whom shove their 
knowledge in others faces only to shut them down, causing them to fall 
behind in class, become depressed, and disengaged. I'm morally obligated to 
discourage this kind of behavior.

It hurts me to see others put down for no reason, especially by those who 
are expected to teach them. Is this the ego you're talking about? If so, 
why even bring it up, should i be ashamed of it..?
comments.author: Skoteh90

comments.text:
+Skoteh90 He actually does what you're suggesting in a lot of his videos. 
You don't see him do it in every edited clip of every person but he does it 
regularly enough. So I wouldn't call that an alternative teaching method 
for him.
The reason I said to examine your ego is because you're projecting what 
you're thinking onto Derek and interpreting his laughter as something 
negative. He's clearly not laughing at the participants in a mocking way. 
Quite the opposite. He's creating a light hearted atmosphere in an attempt 
to make people comfortable with being wrong. He's often laughing when he 
acknowledges that something is counter-intuitive or difficult to grasp. At 
other times he's laughing because the respondents are actually so close to 
the RIGHT answer that he knows they know it deep down inside.
Lastly, these videos are intended to educate people on the internet. Not to 
say that he doesn't want to educate the people he interviews on the street 
but they are also a means to that end. There will always be room to improve 
his delivery but I feel that the people offended by his videos are the ones 
with the greatest egos to protect.
comments.author: Kobayashi Maru

comments.text:
+Kobayashi Maru Gladly.

Btw I never called him a douche because he reveals others lack of knowledge 
of the subject, you have misinterpreted my statement... I called him a 
douche because of *how* he reveals their lack of knowledge about a subject 
that the average person would have no clue how to answer properly. I 
suggested there is a better way*

From what I've seen He asks a difficult question. Then he proceeds to smile 
and laugh in their face and they answer incorrectly. Later he posts their 
incorrect answers on YouTube for millions of people to see. Now if you 
understand basic human psychology, if someone claiming the a doctorate in 
physics authority in a subject laughs at your answer to a question in the 
field he specializes in you would probably feel pretty bad about your 
answer. When you insult someone's intelligence directly like this you hurt 
their confidence in themselves. Now I've read a few well recommended books 
on human psychology that all agree that when you insult someones character 
they "shut down" you could say they become defensive. When someone's in in 
a defensive mindset they are not likely to accept new information, instead 
their brain goes straight to working on how to justify their answer to 
reclaim credibility. No one wants to be seen as "stupid". Have you ever had 
an argument with someone who isn't listening to your side? Maybe Politics? 
Religion? These subjects heavily reflect this pattern people become very 
defensive when it comes to these topics, and unless you're an extremely 
understanding person whom is very open to new information when someone 
insults your "beliefs" no matter the subject chances are you become angry 
and defensive and the discussion (soon to be argument) often leads nowhere 
for both parties.

Instead try a supportive approach that uses praise to build up the 
learner's confidence in their attempts to analyze the situation from the 
knowledge basis of the average person.

How about.... you smile, say "Not a bad answer, I understand why you would 
think that way, and many do. It turns out I'm a physicist and have access 
to current research on the topic and can explain how the actual process 
works. It turns out that the actual solution is more like 'this' because of 
'these reasons', but you were on the right track, nice job."

Please *explain* Kobayashi, how my response is a reflection of my ego? I 
was angry at how his approach to learning is partially destructive for the 
subject in question and how he chose to justify it. I'm looking to bring to 
light what he's trying to avoid.
comments.author: Skoteh90

comments.text:
Then by all means show us a better way. Back up your claim. Just because he 
reveals people's ignorance or misconceptions it doesn't mean he's a douche. 
Maybe if he made fun of them or insulted people for not knowing the answers 
but that's clearly not the case. You feel this way because of your own ego 
so take some time to examine yourself and understand why you feel the way 
you do.

comments.text:
Feelings don't really explain a whole lot. Derek, if you make people feel 
stupid, that's not really your fault. REAL teachers ask students questions 
which help to probe their weaknesses in understanding and guide them 
towards the correct answer. Lazy teachers just lecture and expect students 
to draw the correct conclusions. Don't change the way you make your videos 
because people are accusing you of making them feel stupid. If people 
aren't willing to accept that they don't know everything, they aren't 
willing to learn either.﻿

comments.author: Kobayashi Maru

comments.text:
+Tecnovlog I suggest you read Maurice Merleau-Ponty's "The World of 
Perception and the World of Science."

Classical-age scientist (the ones you described) believed in absolute truth 
and certainty within the field of science when it came to describing 
reality. It wasn't until after Einstein and Neil Bohr that science 
developed into what we call modern-age. Where we know now that science does 
not provide certainty, but only provides accuracy. 

Also, check out Bertrand Russell. 
Merleau-Ponty and Bertrand Russell are both modern-age philosophers; they 
both analyze the justifications made by Descartes on Reality. (Descartes is 
a classical-age philosopher)
comments.author: donutsndcoffee

comments.text:
+Tecnovlog Another point: science isn't about "truth", but about 
establishing ever more accurate models of reality. Which is why it can 
change when new information is integrated into it.
comments.author: morpheus8624

comments.text:
+Tecnovlog Which is a good thing! Science isn't static, it isn't dogma; 
Science changes based on our empirical understanding of the universe, which 
is constantly refined as we learn more.

If light isn't the fastest thing in the universe, great! If rabbits were 
found in the pre-Cambrian, then great! We would have a better understanding 
of physics, biology and geologic timescales as a result.
comments.author: morpheus8624

comments.author: Evgueni Metlitski

comments.text:
Hehe... I get thoose Comments too... because i smile too when someone says 
something stupid.
But it is not for feeling better because I know more than him, it is 
because I have the chance to pass some knowlege to the other, which is for 
someone without some fancy degree that includes a lot of wisdom not so 
common.
So, it is not that I am Happy because someone knows less than me, I am 
happy that I know something and can share it.
I also smile if someone can prove me complete wrong and can provide me with 
the right kind of information.

It is like having a bar of Choclate: Having someone to share with makes it 
taste better. Or have someone, who shares with you his bar. Egocentric? 
Maybe. As love may be egocentric. But I refuse to stop loving because of 
the assumption of other misantropes.

BTW: It is not him making you look stupid. It is you thinking about 
yourself as stupid, so you compare and identificate yourself with the ones 
without the correct answers. And your disregard towards yourself is the 
reason, you feel offended by him. Because he is, from your subjective Point 
of view, the cause of the bad feeling you have.
Stop beating yourself for beeing 'not knowing', admit to yourself that you 
do not know everything. So he won't be offensive anymore and you have done 
the first step to know more than nothing.

*“The ancient oracle said that I was the wisest of all the Greeks. It is 
because I alone, of all the Greeks, know that I know nothing.”*
Sokrates

*"Wisdom is like Disneyland. If you decide to visit each Attraction once on 
a Day, mostly you won't have the Time to enjoy anyone of them."*
Myself﻿

comments.author: Jacob Walley

comments.text:
"This guy's a pretentious douche-bag."

My wife is not into your channel, but she was within ear shot of this 
video. I'm starting with her reaction, because she encapsulates my thoughts 
more succinctly. "This guy may be a douche-bag, but that has nothing to do 
with being pretentious. I mean it doesn't sound like he's pretending to be 
this smart."

I get that some people wouldn't want to have a permanent reminder on the 
internet of their claim that trees are the biggest contributor of CO2, but 
this guy actually helps the rest of us learn more. I don't know if you 
included this in your thesis, but seeing other people get stuff wrong makes 
me feel ok with myself when I'm wrong. I feel for those that are 
embarrassed, but they are performing a public service.

I'm not trying to just get on here, because while I have some understanding 
I know that I would still be HIGHLY embarrassed if I tried to answer some 
of these questions. That being said, I'll throw myself under the bus by 
being one of the wrong answers to prove that the wrong answer is a public 
service.

Jarid.Lawson at Gmail will get you in touch with me.﻿

comments.text:
This is exactly why I love physics so much. To me, there is no other 
subject that induces that "ah ha!" feeling more so. I absolutely LOVE the 
feeling of learning something new. The only reason for learning something 
new is either not having knowledge of it in the first place, or having 
incorrect or misconstrued knowledge. So I completely agree here - lacking 
knowledge does not equate to being unintelligent!! As much as I love 
learning, I love teaching. There's almost no better feeling than having 
that privilege of extending your knowledge to someone who is lacking it. 
Keep on Veritasiuming!﻿
